rpSBMLtoSBOL’s Documentation¶

Introduction¶

Welcome to rpSBMLtoSBOL’s documentation. This tool provides a docker that converts rpSBML files to SBOL files. The project uses the UNIPROT id’s generated by rpSelenzyme to fetch the coding sequences of the heterologous reaction that are generated by RetroPath2.0. Then these are used to generate the SBOL.

docker build -t brsynth/rpsbmltosbml-standalone .

You can run the docker using the following command:

python run.py -input test/test_rpGlobalScore.tar  -input_format tar -output test/test_sbol.tar

API¶

class rpToolServe.runRPSBMLtoSBOL_hdd(inputTar, outputSBOL, rbs=True, max_prot_per_react=3, tirs=None, topX=5, pathway_id='rp_pathway')¶

Convert a collection of rpSBML into a collection of SBOL

Parameters

  • inputTar (str) – The path to the TAR collection of rpSBML

  • outputSBOL (str) – The path to the output TAR collection of SBOL

  • rbs (bool) – Calculate or not the RBS strength

  • max_prot_per_react (int) – The maximum number of proteins per reaction (Default: 3)

  • tirs (list) – The RBS strength values

  • topX (int) – The top number of UNIPROT id’s per reaction to use

  • pathway_id (str) – The Groups id of the heterologous pathway

Return type

bool

Returns

The success or failure of the function

class rpTool.convert(sbml_filepaths, sbol_filename, rbs, max_prot_per_react=3, tirs=None, pathway_id='rp_pathway')¶

Convert an rpSBML file to a SBOL file

Parameters

  • sbml_filepaths (str) – The path to the rpSBML file

  • sbol_filename (str) – The path to the SBOL file

  • rbs (bool) – Calculate or not the RBS strength

  • max_prot_per_react (int) – The maximum number of proteins per reaction (Default: 3)

  • tirs (list) – The RBS strength values

  • pathway_id (str) – The Groups id of the heterologous pathway

Return type

None

Returns

None

Access the conversion using the command line

Parameters

args (list) – Arguments

Return type

None

Returns

None

class run.main(inputfile, input_format, output, rbs, max_prot_per_react, tirs, topX, pathway_id)¶

Call the docker to convert a collection of rpSBML into a collection of SBOL

Parameters

  • inputfile (str) – The path to the TAR collection of rpSBML

  • intput_format – The input format of the file. Valid options: tar, sbml

  • output (str) – The path to the output TAR collection of SBOL

  • rbs (bool) – Calculate or not the RBS strength

  • max_prot_per_react (int) – The maximum number of proteins per reaction (Default: 3)

  • tirs (list) – The RBS strength values

  • topX (int) – The top number of UNIPROT id’s per reaction to use

  • pathway_id (str) – The Groups id of the heterologous pathway

Return type

None

Returns

None
